bibl.title: Letter from Richard B. Ritchey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 26, 1932

div1.p: Ritchey sends Emilie Lawrence Reed a copy of Whittaker's article on Reed and yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Richard B. Ritchey to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 26, 1932
div1.opener:
RICHARD B. RITCHEY
MERCERSBURG, PENNSYLVANIA
June 26- 1932
Mrs Walter Reed
Blue Ridge Summit Pa
Dear Mrs Reed
div1.p:
Your message through my Sister Grace
received and I am sending you herewith
the address of the young man who delivered
the oration “Unsung Heroes” which I considered
very fine and I felt you should have it
Mr James Curran track coach (who Blossom Knows)
borrowed the original manuscript and I
had our bank stenographer & strike off two copies and
I am enclosing you the second that you
can send it to the Coronel without you
going to the trouble of having a copy made
We are delighted to hear of Blossom success
and are patiently waiting for her to come
back to us for a long visit she can certainly
make us forget our troubles and make us
cheery

Love from us both
To Blossom and your self
div1.closer:
Very Cordially R B Ritchey Ralph R Whittaker
220 High St
Williamsburg Pa
